article.headline: Alabama 71, Auburn 61
article.story: TUSCALOOSA, Ala. (AP) -- Alonzo Gee scored a career-high 21 points and hit back-to-back 3-pointers to help Alabama rally to a 71-61 victory over Auburn on Wednesday night. The Crimson Tide (17-10, 10-5 Southeastern Conference) trailed by as many as 11 points late in the first half, but held the Tigers to 33 percent shooting after the half. Alabama has won 21 of the last 22 meetings with Auburn (12-14, 4-11) at Coleman Coliseum and clinched the No. 2 Western Division seed in the SEC tournament and a first-round bye with the win. The Tide trailed 31-26 at halftime, but Gee's two early 3-pointers closed the gap and Ronald Steele's driving layup with 16:36 left gave Alabama its first lead. They were also Steele's first points of the game, and the Tide pushed its lead as high as 14 points and didn't trail again. Gee made 8-of-12 shots, including three 3-pointers, for Alabama. He had scored six key points in the final minutes of the Tide's win earlier this season at Auburn. Jermareo Davidson had 14 points while Jean Felix had 13. Steele finished with nine points and five assists, all in the second half. Ronny LeMelle led Auburn with 18 points, hitting four 3s, while Rasheem Barrett added 10. But the Tigers made just 8-of-28 3s and were 3-of-12 from the free throw line in the second half. Alabama and its fans both temporarily lost their cool in the first half after a start that produced few baskets by either team. The Tigers hit two straight 3-pointers and Davidson was called for an offensive foul en route to an 11-0 run after Alabama briefly tied the game at 15-all. Alabama coach Mark Gottfried drew a technical for protesting the call, then had to grab a microphone to urge fans not to throw objects onto the court after an official was hit by a quarter flung from the stands. Daniel Hayles hit his third 3-pointer with 5 seconds left to extend Auburn's halftime margin, but wouldn't score in the second half. It was the final home game for Alabama seniors Evan Brock and Felix. Brock was wearing the No. 1 jersey of fellow senior Chuck Davis, out for the season with a knee injury. Felix punctuated the game with a dunk at the buzzer.
